stem: Which of the following is NOT true regarding chickenpox?
opt1: Varicella is highly contagious and the patient should be carefully isolated
opt2: Varicella has a comparatively shorter incubation period of 5 days
opt3: Varicella is no longer contagious when all lesions are crusted over
opt4: Varicella may be lethal in immunocompromised hosts
disc:
The average incubation period of varicella is 14-16 days (ranges from 10-21 days). The infective period is generally from 48 hours before the onset of the rash until the lesions have fully crusted.

In immunocompromised patients, it can be fatal and should be treated aggressively.
